fs.xml
Interface ResourceDependent

All Known Implementing Classes:
EditCloseTabComponent, LogHistoryWindow, PolyglotStringTable, ResourceDirectory, SwingAppender
public interface ResourceDependent

This interface indicates that a class, especially the implementation, depends on certain file resources (usually Schema files, templates, etc..). A corruption, removal or change of these resources might render that class's behavior unpredictable.
The class is supposed to be able to give a full account of these files that are all supposed to be located relative to a common base directory that might be determined dynamically, e.g. if a certain library is integrated in a personal project in some exotic subdirectory that would hence not be found under the standard library path.

Author:
Simon Hampe

Method Summary
 void assignReference(ResourceReference r)
          Assigns a ResourceReference to this object, that can be used to retrieve the actual file paths for its resources
 org.dom4j.Document getExpectedResourceStructure()
          Returns an XML document, whose structure reflects the file/folder dependencies this class expects to be satisfied.
 

Method Detail

getExpectedResourceStructure

org.dom4j.Document getExpectedResourceStructure()
Returns an XML document, whose structure reflects the file/folder dependencies this class expects to be satisfied. The format of this document is completely arbitrary, it should be interpreted as follows:
- The root node corresponds to the base directory (but does not have to carry the same name)
- Every non-leaf node corresponds to a directory with the nodes name as directory name
- Every leaf node corresponds to a directory or file with the nodes name as directory/file name
- Text contents of nodes are generally ignored

assignReference

void assignReference(ResourceReference r)
Assigns a ResourceReference to this object, that can be used to retrieve the actual file paths for its resources
